Simulate EI Solution via Importance Sampling

Source: R/ei_sim.R
ei.sim.Rd

Simulate EI Solution via Importance Sampling

Usage

ei.sim(ei.object, ndraws = 99, nsims = 100)

Arguments

ei.object

ei object

ndraws

integer. The number of draws. Default is 99.

nsims

integer. The number of simulations within each draw. Default is 100.

Value

ei.sim object

References

Gary King (1997). A Solution to the Ecological Inference Problem. Princeton: Princeton University Press.

Author

Gary King <<email: king@harvard.edu>> and Molly Roberts <<email: molly.e.roberts@gmail.com>>

Examples

data(sample_ei)
form <- t ~ x
ei_obj <- ei(form, total = "n", data = sample_ei, simulate = FALSE)
#> ℹ Running 2x2 ei
#> ℹ Maximizing likelihood for `erho` = 0.5.
#> ℹ Running 2x2 ei

#> ✔ Running 2x2 ei [1ms]
#> 
sims <- ei.sim(ei_obj)
#> ⠙ Beginning importance sampling.
#> ✔ Beginning importance sampling. [68ms]
#>
